result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Felicelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven A. Felicelli is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven A. Felicelli was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $ 250.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Obey all rules in 14-CF-1068. Concurrent to 14-CF-1068.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
from Alicia N jh
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Fred Zievers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  917 -   Victim rights compliance. Case is resolved. DE enters plea of no contest as to Ct1 - found guilty by the Court. Ct2 dismissed outright per plea agreement. Sentencing recommendations made.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions concurrent to 14CF1068.  No sentence credit.  $250 fine plus court costs ordered.  No restitution requested. DE is ordered to pay DNA $200 surcharge, but no sample is required and notice is given. Appeal rights given.
State's list of Exhibits - filed by ADA T Braun.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA T Braun.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frederick Zievers.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10am-  Court notes that the DE demanded a speedy trial - DE is currently on a signature bond.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 11/13/2015.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frederick Zievers.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found.  Bound over to Br. 7.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  Speedy trial demanded and jury trial demanded by def.  FPT 10/1/15 at 9:30.  Bond continued.

*No Contact w/Alicia N or her residence.
